description: Plans have been announced for two services to remember former Auburn tight end Philip Lutzenkirchen.
title: Services set for former Auburn star Lutzenkirchen
title_page: Services set for former Auburn star Lutzenkirchen
text:
Plans have been announced for two services to remember former Auburn tight end Philip Lutzenkirchen.
According to the Columbus Ledger-Enquirer, a memorial service is scheduled for 8 p.m. Wednesday at the Lassiter High School football stadium.
A funeral Mass is planned for 1 p.m. Thursday at Transfiguration Catholic Church. A visitation is planned before the service, beginning at 10:30 a.m.
Lutzenkirchen, 23, was killed in a car crash near LaGrange early Sunday. The one-vehicle accident happened around 3 a.m. at the intersection of Upper Big Springs Road and Lower Big Springs Road, the Georgia State Patrol said.
Also killed in the wreck was the University of Georgiaâ€™s Joseph Ian Davis, 22, of Dunwoody. Davis was driving a 2006 Chevrolet Tahoe with three passengers, including Lutzenkirchen, who was in the back seat of the SUV, GSP said. At the T-shaped intersection, Davis apparently missed a stop sign. The SUV barreled about 450 feet through a church yard and flipped over several times before coming to rest on its roof. Davis was partially ejected and Lutzenkirchen was completely ejected.
Two others were injured, the GSP said.
